snippet: Images of the school in Aleppo showed pools of blood and children’s drawings, after a blast that reportedly killed at least 20 people, including 17 students.
abstract: Syrian government aircraft bombard elementary school in Aleppo hours before opening of children's art exhibit there; at least 20 people are killed, including 17 students and two teachers, and wounded include school principal and local artist who mounted exhibit.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and HWAIDA SAAD

lead_paragraph: Images of the school in Aleppo showed pools of blood and children’s drawings, after a blast that reportedly killed at least 20 people, including 17 students.

headline.main: Children’s Art at Syria School, and Then a Bomb
headline.print_headline: Children’s Art at Syria School, and Then a Bomb

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
